abstract.p: H&R Block names Campbell Mithun Esty to handle creative duties for its worldwide advertising account, with billings estimated at $100 million (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Blattner Brunner in Pittsburgh said yesterday that it had acquired Egan/St. James in Pittsburgh from EPB Communications in New York. Terms were not disclosed.

Last August, EPB acquired Egan/ St. James, once the Pittsburgh office of Ketchum Advertising, from the Omnicom Group. EPB later approached Blattner Brunner about buying that agency, too, but instead, Blattner Brunner proposed buying Egan/St. James.
Blattner Brunner in Pittsburgh said yesterday that it had acquired Egan/St. James in Pittsburgh from EPB Communications in New York. Terms were not disclosed.

Last August, EPB acquired Egan/ St. James, once the Pittsburgh office of Ketchum Advertising, from the Omnicom Group. EPB later approached Blattner Brunner about buying that agency, too, but instead, Blattner Brunner proposed buying Egan/St. James.

Egan/St. James, with 24 employees and billings estimated at $15 million from clients like Zippo will be absorbed into Blattner Brunner, which has 91 employees and billings estimated at more than $60 million from clients like the American Beverage Corporation and Sky Bank.

Joe Blattner, 45, chairman and chief executive at Blattner Brunner, and Michael Brunner, 47, president and chief operating officer, continue in those posts. Dave Egan, 42, president at Egan/St. James, becomes vice president and director for client services at Blattner Brunner.
